introduce.title: Kirill Shevtsov
introduce.para1: Frontend Developer with over 6 years of experience creating web applications and websites of different complexities. Skilled in building cross-browser, responsive, and accessible interfaces using modern JavaScript frameworks.
introduce.para2: Familiar with UI/UX best practices, performance optimization, and maintaining clean, scalable code. Comfortable working independently or as part of a distributed team, with a practical approach to solving problems. Looking for a long-term, full-time remote role to contribute to meaningful projects and continue growing professionally.

metadata.title: Kirill Shevtsov — Frontend and Web Developer
metadata.description: Frontend & Web Developer with 7+ years of experience. Building fast, accessible, and scalable web applications.

heroText.term1: Hi! I’m Kirill — a frontend and web developer who turns ideas into living, fast, and thoughtfully crafted web products.
heroText.term2: For over 7 years, I’ve been building modern websites and web applications — from elegant landing pages to complex interfaces with sophisticated business logic. I care deeply about how a product feels, not just how it looks: it should be fast, responsive, accessible, and intuitive for the user.
heroText.term3: I work across the full spectrum of modern web technologies — from architecture and visual design to performance, animations, and interactivity. I have a strong understanding of UI/UX, write clean and maintainable code, and always think about scalability and the long-term future of a project. I’m comfortable working both independently and within distributed teams, and I’m looking for a long-term remote collaboration where I can build meaningful products, grow as an engineer, and deliver real value.

metadata.title: Kirill Shevtsov — Experience
metadata.description: Over 7 years of frontend and web development experience, focused on performance, UX and scalable interfaces.

contactText.term1: Have an idea, a project, or just want to connect?
contactText.term2: I’m open to collaborations, new connections, and meaningful challenges. If you want to build something that truly matters — let’s talk.
contactText.term3: Feel free to reach out in any way that works for you — sometimes the best projects start with a simple connection.

umlaut.name: Umlaut.Digital
umlaut.excerpt: Dynamic. Minimal. Live. Umlaut.Digital® on the web.
umlaut.description: Together with the design team, we built a modern digital showcase for Umlaut Digital. While the designers focused on UI/UX, I handled the full technical delivery: building the frontend architecture, implementing pixel-perfect layouts, adding smooth animations, and optimizing performance. The result is a fast, stable, and production-ready website that helps the agency present itself to clients at the highest level.

ask4games.name: Ask4Games
ask4games.excerpt: Ask4Games — your gateway to the world of gaming and esports.
ask4games.description: Ask4Games is a vibrant digital hub for gamers of all kinds — from console and mobile players to esports fans. The portal brings together news, reviews, and community-driven content in a dynamic, engaging format. My role was the full technical implementation: building a scalable frontend, optimizing performance, and ensuring a smooth, interactive experience for every visitor.

dopomoga.name: Dopomoga
dopomoga.excerpt: An information portal for internally displaced persons in Ukraine, providing quick access to vital resources and support.
dopomoga.description: The project was created to help internally displaced persons in Ukraine. It was developed in a short time and with limited resources. The portal combines key information, contacts, and resources in one convenient space. The goal is to make the adaptation process easier and to provide access to help quickly and clearly. Thanks to a structured approach and a user-friendly interface, the site has become an effective support tool for people in difficult life circumstances. The site is currently out of active use due to changing needs of the target audience, but, with the consent of the owners, it remains available as an example of my work (link to the GitHub page above).

solvedTasks.term2: Implemented responsive design to ensure accessibility on various devices, including smartphones and tablets.
solvedTasks.term3: Configured VPS hosting and website publishing, optimized performance.

gifApp.description: A progressive web app (PWA) designed for fast search and easy sharing of GIF animations. Developed as a test assignment for a company, with a focus on performance, user-friendly interface, and modern frontend technologies.

solvedTasks.term1: Implemented a web app using the Progressive Web App (PWA) technology with the ability to install on the user's device.

solvedTasks.term3: Implemented infinite scrolling functionality using Throttle to improve the user experience when browsing search results.
solvedTasks.term4: Implemented GIF sharing functionality using the native Web Share API.

prevPortfolio.name: First Portfolio
prevPortfolio.excerpt: Previous portfolio website — My very first portfolio, where I experimented with structure, style, and technology. Simple, but meaningful as the starting point of my professional journey.
prevPortfolio.description: This was my very first portfolio website, built entirely from scratch. While it looks modest compared to my current work, it represents the foundation of my growth as a developer. Here I learned how to structure layouts, experiment with styling, and bring ideas to life on the web. It’s a project I look back on with warmth, as it marks the true beginning of my professional journey.

emailSendForm.excerpt: Email form with attachments. Fast, simple, user-friendly.

aviaTicketsApp.name: Flight Filter App
aviaTicketsApp.excerpt: An application for searching flights with a filter by the number of transfers.
aviaTicketsApp.description: A flight search app with a transfers filter. One of my first projects was created to practice working with React and Redux. Although it is a simple project, it helped me understand the basics of state management in React applications.

karpatyJourney.name: Karpaty Journey
karpatyJourney.excerpt: Several mountain routes through the Ukrainian Carpathians on a map with photos and descriptions.
karpatyJourney.description: Interactive maps are my passion. In this project, I visualized several mountain routes through the Ukrainian Carpathians on a map, accompanied by photos and descriptions. This project combines my love of nature and technology, creating a useful resource for travelers and mountain hikers.

solvedTasks.term1: Implemented binding and visualization of geodata on the map using OpenStreetMap and Leaflet.js.

solvedTasks.term4: Used the Geolocation API to determine the user's current location and display it on the map.
